intro: Olynthia disticha, commonly known as the two-branched olynthia, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive two-branched inflorescence, which sets it apart from other members of the orchid family. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions with rich, well-drained soil. Its flowers are small and delicate, often displaying a combination of white and pale yellow hues. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Olynthia disticha is considered a species of conservation concern.
